availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: George M. Jackson (Winchester, Kentucky, editor and soldier)

body.p: Winchester, Kentucky, editor. Kentucky native. Son of Josiah A. Jackson and Elizabeth Martin Jackson. Resident of Estill County, Kentucky, in 1850. Editor of the National Union in Winchester in 1860. Served in the 4th Kentucky Volunteer Infantry Regiment (U.S.A.) as a private and captain from October 9, 1861 to November 7, 1862.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Estill County, p. 104A-B.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Clark County, Winchester, p. 73.
Report of the Adjutant General of the State of Kentucky, vol. 1, 1861-1866 (Frankfort: Kentucky Yeoman Office, 1866), p. 650-1.
Compiled Service Records of Volunteer Union Soldiers who Served in Organizations From the State of Kentucky, NARA RG 94, Microfilm Series M397, Roll 0481.
